dmca.title: #HD0000000293980-ABUSE;CUST; THE PLANET;DMCA/Copyright complaint from 67.19.79.66 / h
dmca.body:
-----Original Message-----
From: Cogent Help Desk [mailto:abuse@cogentco.com] 
Sent: Friday, June 10, 2005 5:18 AM
To: gpoletes@theplanet.com; lcrosby@theplanet.com; wcharnock@theplanet.com
Cc: abuse@cogentco.com
Subject: #HD0000000293980-ABUSE;CUST; THE PLANET;DMCA/Copyright complaint
from 67.19.79.66 /
http://www.sharebigfile.com/index.php?download=dEgK2dK7tKUxAx2Nlo3F 

THE PLANET,
 
Attached is a Notice of Infringement received by Cogent Communications legal
department. It appears that this Notice is ultimately intended for your or
one of your customers who may be utilizing your relationship with Cogent
Communications to access the Internet or host copyright infringement
materials. 
We are not taking any position concerning the validity of this Notice or
what, if any, actions you should take in response to it. 
However, we should remind you that when utilizing your relationship with
Cogent Communications are required to comply with our Acceptable Use Policy,
and a violation of that policy may be considered a violation of the terms of
your customer agreement with us. Our AUP policy can be found at
http://cogentco.com/policy.html. 
Please respond with your plan of action. 

Thank you,
Chris Haggard
Cogent Communications, Inc. 
Abuse Team
abuse@cogentco.com

-----Original Message-----
From:
Sent: Tuesday, June 07, 2005 9:34 AM
To: abuse@cogentco.com
Subject: DMCA Notice (Ref: R5631)
Importance: High

07 June 2005
Abuse Contact
Cogent Communications
1015 31st St
Washington, DC
20007
United States
Telephone: +1 202 295 4200
Fax: +1 202 388 8798
E-mail: abuse@cogentco.com
Ref: R5631
Re: 
http://www.sharebigfile.com/index.php?download=dEgK2dK7tKUxAx2Nlo3F
Dear Sir/Madam,
I am contacting you on behalf of the International Federation of the
Phonographic Industry (IFPI) and its member record companies. The IFPI is a
trade association whose member companies are some 1,450 major and
independent record companies in the US and internationally who create,
manufacture and distribute sound recordings. Under penalty of perjury, we
submit that the IFPI is authorized to act on behalf of its member companies
in matters involving the infringement of their sound recordings, including
enforcing their copyrights and common law rights on the Internet.
We have learned that your service is hosting the above infringing file on
its network. This file contains sound recordings by the artists known as
Jamiroquai. These sound recordings are owned by one of our member companies
and have not been authorized for this kind of use. We have a good faith
belief that the above-described activity is not authorized by the copyright
owner, its agent, or the law. We assert that the information in this
notification is accurate, based upon the data available to us.
We are asking for your immediate assistance in stopping this unauthorized
activity. Specifically, we request that you remove the infringing file from
your system or that you disable access to the infringing file. In addition,
please inform the site operator of the illegality of his or her conduct.
You should understand that this letter constitutes notice to you that this
site operator may be liable for the infringing activity occurring on your
service. In addition, under the Digital Millennium Copyright Act, if you
ignore this notice, you and/or your company may also be liable for any
resulting infringement. This letter does not constitute a waiver of any
right to recover damages incurred by virtue of any such unauthorized
activities, and such rights as well as claims for other relief are expressly
retained.
You may contact me at IFPI Secretariat, 54 Regent Street, London W1B 5RE,
United Kingdom or email Notices@ifpi.org, to discuss this notice. We await
your response.
 
Faithfully,
Mr Paul Mitchell
Internet Anti-Piracy Administrator
IFPI Secretariat
